bt.data.digest

Interface Digester

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    JavaSecurityDigester

    public interface Digester
    Calculates hash of some binary data. Implementations may use different hashing algorithms.
    Since:
    1.2

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Digester createCopy()
      Clone the digester so any thread local variables will be cleaned up when the clone is GC'd
      byte[] digest(DataRange data)
      Calculates a digest of a data range.
      byte[] digest(Range<?> data)
      Calculates Digest of a binary range.
      byte[] digestForced(DataRange data)
      Calculates a digest of a data range.
      int length()
      Return the length of this digest

    • Method Detail

      • digest

        byte[] digest(DataRange data)
        Calculates a digest of a data range.

        Important: If some of the data can't be read immediately (e.g. due to idiosyncrasies of underlying storage), then this method may return incorrect result.

        Returns:
        Digest (depends on the algorithm being used)
        Since:
        1.2

      • digestForced

        byte[] digestForced(DataRange data)
        Calculates a digest of a data range. Throws IllegalStateException if any StorageUnit does not return enough data.
        Returns:
        Digest (depends on the algorithm being used)
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if the underlying StorageUnits in the DataRange return less than StorageUnit.size() from StorageUnit.readBlockFully(java.nio.ByteBuffer, long). This can happen because the storage in the underlying storage units is lazily allocated.
        Since:
        1.9

      • digest

        byte[] digest(Range<?> data)
        Calculates Digest of a binary range.
        Returns:
        Digest (depends on the algorithm being used)
        Since:
        1.3

      • length

        int length()
        Return the length of this digest
        Returns:
        the length of this digest
        Since:
        1.10

      • createCopy

        Digester createCopy()
        Clone the digester so any thread local variables will be cleaned up when the clone is GC'd
        Returns:
        the copy of the digester
